feed.title: vEver's garden
feed.subtitle: A collection of posts focused on mathematics and cryptography with occasional CTF writeups

entry.title: RC4 + FMS attack
entry.summary: RC4 Rivest Cipher 4 (RC4) was designed by Ron Rivest and first published (or rather, leaked) in 1994. It’s considered a stream cipher, where the key generates a keystream that’s combined with the plaintext (usually through XOR $\oplus$). Generating the keystream is split into two steps: The Key-scheduling Algorithm (KSA) initializes a permutated array of all 256 bytes while mixing in the...
